title: EIP-7807: SSZ execution blocks
description: Migrates execution blocks to SSZ format, enabling normalized block hashes that allow the consensus layer to verify execution blocks independently, optimized binary engine API reducing data exchange by ~50%, provable individual block header fields via Merkle proofs, and cleanup of historical PoW-era fields.
author: Etan Kissling (@etan-status), Gajinder Singh (@g11tech)
laymanDescription: Converts Ethereum execution block data to a more efficient format (SSZ) that reduces data transmission overhead, enables cryptographic proofs of individual block fields, and simplifies coordination between consensus and execution layers.

appDevs.description: Verifying applications benefit from provable block header fields without requiring full headers.

toolingInfra.description: Binary beacon-API style encoding simplifies RPC server design and reduces conversion overhead.

layer2s.description: Simpler verification of block data with forward-compatible Merkle proofs.

stakersNodes.description: CL can sync optimistically without EL during maintenance periods.

clClients.description: No longer need RLP/MPT support for optimistic sync; can verify block hashes independently.

elClients.description: Significant implementation work: database schema, network protocol, and internal logic changes required.

benefits: CL can verify execution block hashes independently without waiting for engine API responses.
Binary SSZ engine API reduces data exchange by ~50% and improves encoding efficiency.
Individual block header fields become provable via forward-compatible Merkle proofs.
Enables cleanup of historical PoW-era fields and inefficient logs bloom mechanism.
tradeoffs: Breaks compatibility for smart contracts depending on previous block header binary format.
